metadata.title: CVE-2016-2368 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple memory corruption vulnerabilities exist in the handling of theMXIT protocol in Pidgin. Specially crafted MXIT data sent via the servercould result in multiple buffer overflows, potentially resulting in codeexecution or memory disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2368` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

finch - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
libpurple-bin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
libpurple0 - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
pidgin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
pidgin-data - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pidgin package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3').
